name: Ranger
description: Guardians of the wilderness who keep unending watch far from bustling cities. Rangers learn to track quarry like predators, moving stealthily through trackless forests and across wide plains, hiding in brush and rubble.

1.Favored Enemy: You always have the Hunter's Mark spell prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare. You can cast Hunter's Mark without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a Long Rest before you can cast it this way again.
1.Spellcasting: You have learned to cast spells through your connection to nature. You prepare two level 1 Ranger spells. Animal Friendship and Cure Wounds are recommended.
1.Weapon Mastery: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as Longbows and Shortswords.

2.Deft Explorer: Thanks to your experience in the wild, you gain two of the following benefits of your choice: Canny, Roving, or Tireless.
2.Fighting Style: You gain a Fighting Style feat of your choice. Archery, Defense, Dueling, or Two-Weapon Fighting are recommended.

3.Ranger Subclass: You gain a Ranger Subclass of your choice.
3.Primeval Awareness: Your familiarity with the wilderness gives you a special awareness of threats around you. As a Magic action, you can expend a spell slot to focus your awareness on the region around you for 1 minute per level of the spell slot you expend.

4.Ability Score Improvement: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

5.Extra Attack: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.Roving: Your Speed increases by 10 feet, and you have a Climb Speed and Swim Speed equal to your Speed.
6.Subclass Feature: You gain a feature from your Ranger subclass.

7.Subclass Feature: You gain a feature from your Ranger subclass.

8.Ability Score Improvement: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

Expertise.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your Proficiency Bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

9.Tireless: Primal forces now help sustain you. As a Magic action, you can give yourself a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

10.Nature's Veil: You invoke spirits of nature to magically hide yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can expend a spell slot to give yourself the Invisible condition for 1 minute or until you make an attack roll or cast a spell.

11.Subclass Feature: You gain a feature from your Ranger subclass.

12.Ability Score Improvement: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

13.Relentless Hunter: Your Hunter's Mark becomes more deadly. The extra damage of the spell increases to 1d10, and when the target of the spell drops to 0 Hit Points, the spell doesn't end, instead transferring to another creature you can see within range.

14.Nature's Veil Improvement: When you use your Nature's Veil feature, you can also give the Invisible condition to a number of willing allies within 10 feet of yourself equal to your Wisdom modifier.

15.Subclass Feature: You gain a feature from your Ranger subclass.

16.Ability Score Improvement: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

17.Precise Hunter: Your Hunter's Mark reaches its peak power. You always have the spell prepared, and when you cast it, you can target two creatures within range instead of one.

18.Subclass Feature: You gain a feature from your Ranger subclass.

19.Epic Boon: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. Boon of Dimensional Travel is recommended.

20.Enemy Slayer: You have become a master hunter. Once per turn, when you deal damage with Hunter's Mark to the target of that spell, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the damage.
